intro: Thlaspi bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia and the European Alps, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically rosette-shaped, adapted to withstand cold and harsh conditions. Thlaspi bornmuelleri is often found in meadows and on mountain slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
